description.narrative:
Kampong Thom province is the most natural disaster affected province as other provinces in the country. 31% of family use water from well, there are 18,262 wells are available in the Kampong Thom (source: data of department of planning 2015). Underground water level is higher particularly in most of village situated along Stung Sen river bank, which range from 10 to 30 meters deep. Most people in the rural area of Kampong Thom face shortage of water for domestic use and water supply for farming in the dry season.
The project seeks to address the above issues/problems through promoting women and youth to involve in saving and support them to gain access to more financial services in their community. Saving for Change group will be used as a platform Agriculture Cooperative (AC) and mechanism for women and youth to mobilize resources and dialogue and raise issue and needs to sub-national and nation government bodies and private sectors.
The aim of this project is to improve women#s economic positionin agriculture value chains so that women enjoy a bigger share of the value they produce. The project will seek men#s participation and involvement to challenge gender imbalances. It will support women#s collectives# access to key inputs, information andskills and their capacity to influence positively Private Sector and Government policies and practices. It will seek to support women to use a variety of tools to document project successes and to bring this evidence to key spaces. There are one goal and3 objective are: project goal #Women#s economic position in agriculture value chains improved so that women enjoy a bigger share of the value they produce# and objective 1) Women smallholder farmers increased quantity and quality of their products, obtainedbetter prices, and reduced their exposure to risk, 2) Women participating in collective groups (formal or informal) increased their power and opportunities to compete and engage successfully in theirlocal markets and 3) Participating women and men recognized their gender imbalances and taken joint actions to foster a more equal decision making processes at the household level. The project will direct 1,750 households from SfC members and not SfC member in target area. AFD will provide capacity building on technical agriculture rice poultry raising and technical support.

participating-org.narrative: Action For Development (AFD) is a non-profit organization. It is a local NGOs that focus on livelihood, good government, natural resource and environment management. AFD established in 2004, and registered with Ministry of Interior in 2006. AFD and Oxfamhave worked in partnership since 2008 for development program in natural resource management and livelihood sector. AFD has mission to work in partnership to secure rights of natural resource dependent communities, increasing influence over democratic decision making ensuring suitable natural resource management supports diversity conservation and climate change adaptation by raising income and food security to alleviate poverty. It has vision #AFD believes that all people are equal to live their lives with dignity and respectfullyparticipating in transparent and accountable rural development decisions that alleviate poverty and suffering and protect Cambodia#s rich diversity.# AFD has experienced in emergency response in Kampong Thom with Oxfam in 2009and 2011, recovery in 2012. AFD support Oxfam implementing emergency response. It followed the design of emergency response working as joint activities to release humanitarian assistance.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to a sustainable livelihood
